channel.title: Bloomberg Politics
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Milei Clamps Down on Immigration to ‘Make Argentina Great Again’
item.description: President Javier Milei is tightening up Argentina’s immigration laws as part of his effort to further pare back public spending, making another nod to close ally Donald Trump in the process.
item.dc:creator: Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: Javier Milei appears at the Conservative Political Action Conference in National Harbor, Maryland on Feb. 22. Photographer: Kent Nishimura/Bloomberg

item.title: Sanofi to Invest at Least $20 Billion in US Through 2030
item.description: Sanofi SA said it will invest at least $20 billion in the US through 2030, joining other European pharmaceutical companies boosting their American operations as President Donald Trump threatens to impose tariffs and cut prices on drugs.
item.dc:creator: Eric Pfanner

media:content.media:description: A logo at the Sanofi SA campus in the Gentilly district of Paris, France, on Tuesday, April 25, 2023. Sanofi is due to report results on Thursday, with analysts focused on the performance of key drug Dupixent. Photographer: Nathan Laine/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Says Visit to Turkey for Russia-Ukraine Talks Unlikely
item.description: US President Donald Trump downplayed the chances that he’ll visit Turkey on Thursday for peace talks between Russia and Ukraine as the odds for Vladimir Putin to be there grow increasingly slim.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump speaks to travelling media aboard Air Force One as he flies to Doha, Qatar on May 14.

item.title: House Speaker Defends Trump’s Plan to Accept Qatar’s Luxury Plane
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson defended President Donald Trump’s plans to receive a luxury jet from Qatar, saying he doesn’t think the gift raises ethics concerns.
item.dc:creator: Emily Birnbaum

media:content.media:description: House Speaker Mike Johnson, , left, and President Donald Trump at the White House on March 24.

item.title: Lula and Xi Agree to Boost Chinese Presence in Brazil Despite Trump's Threats
item.description: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva insists he doesn’t want to pick between the US and China as his two largest trading partners wage a trade war. But it’s increasingly clear which side he has already chosen.
item.dc:creator: Simone Iglesias, Leonardo Lara, Daniel Carvalho

media:content.media:description: Xi Jinping and Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in 2024.

item.title: Ruling Party in Ethiopia’s Tigray Region Loses Legal Recognition
item.description: Ethiopia’s election board nullified its legal recognition of the party that rules the volatile northern Tigray region and waged a two-year war against the federal government amid ongoing divisions within its ranks.
item.dc:creator: Fasika Tadesse

media:content.media:description: People walk in front of the head office of the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front (TPLF), the ruling party in the region, in the city of Mekele, northern Ethiopia, on September 6, 2020.

item.title: US Announces More Than $243 Billion in Deals With Qatar
item.description: The White House said President Donald Trump had secured deals totaling more than $243.5 billion with Qatar, laying the groundwork for a bigger $1.2 trillion economic pledge with the tiny Gulf country.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Hadriana Lowenkron

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump and Tamim bin Hamad al Thani attend a signing ceremony at the Amiri Diwan in Doha, Qatar, on May 14. Photographer: Win McNamee/Getty Images

item.title: Ukraine’s Marchenko to Travel to Finance Chiefs’ G-7 Summit
item.description: Ukrainian Finance Minister Serhiy Marchenko will travel next week to Banff, Alberta, where his counterparts in Group of Seven countries are holding their annual summit.
item.dc:creator: Erik Hertzberg

media:content.media:description: Serhiy Marchenko

item.title: Norway Bets $800 Million on Blackstone Logistics, Warehouse Fund
item.description: Norway’s sovereign wealth fund committed $800 million to Blackstone Inc. to invest in warehouses and logistics, ratcheting up a bet on North American supply chains.
item.dc:creator: Dawn Lim

media:content.media:description: A worker operates a forklift past boxes of imported pork at a cold storage warehouse in Shanghai, China, on Wednesday, March 5, 2025. China will impose tariffs on a slew of US farm products as part of its countermeasures against Washington, threatening to disrupt a major portion of trade between the two agricultural powerhouses. Photographer: Raul Ariano/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Officials Resist Sharing How Migrants Were Tagged as Gangsters
item.description: The Trump administration doesn’t want to reveal how it came to allege that some New York City-area Venezuelans it is seeking to deport are members of the Tren de Aragua gang.
item.dc:creator: Robert Burnson

media:content.media:description: TECOLUCA, EL SALVADOR - MARCH 26: A prisoner with a tattoo with leg irons on stands as Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem tours the Terrorist Confinement Center (CECOT) on March 26, 2025 in Tecoluca, El Salvador. The Trump administration deported 238 alleged members of the Venezuelan criminal organizations 'Tren De Aragua' and Mara Salvatrucha with only 23 being members of the Mara. Nayib Bukele president of El Salvador announced that his government will receive the alleged members of the gang to be taken to CECOT. (Photo by Alex Brandon-Pool/Getty Images)

item.title: Trump Memecoin Speculator Says Presidential Dinner Is Costing Him Just $1,200
item.description: Morten Christensen says he and four crypto-loving friends will be attending the dinner next week being held for the top holders of President Donald Trump’s memecoin for just about $1,200 each.
item.dc:creator: Olga Kharif

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump during an Easter prayer service and dinner in the Blue Room of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, April 16, 2025. Trump said negotiators made "big progress" in a meeting with Japanese officials seeking a deal to avoid higher levies he has threatened against US trading partners.

item.title: Trump’s Freebie Qatar Jet Is Nightmare Scenario in Spyworld
item.description: Qatar’s offer of a luxury Boeing 747 to President Donald Trump has set off alarm bells within the US intelligence and diplomatic community, where gifts from foreign powers have long been viewed with suspicion.
item.dc:creator: Jamie Tarabay

media:content.media:description: Trump boards Air Force One on May 12 for his Middle East trip.

item.title: Texas Sweetens Pitch to CEOs, Boards With New State Protections
item.description: Texas is trying to entice more companies to ditch Delaware and incorporate in the state, just like Tesla Inc. and Space Exploration Technologies Corp. did last year at the behest of Elon Musk.
item.dc:creator: Joe Lovinger

media:content.media:description: Greg Abbott

item.title: China Suspends Retaliatory US Export Controls, Sanctions
item.description: China is suspending a trade and investment ban against more than a dozen US companies as part of the trade agreement struck by the world’s two biggest economies.
item.dc:creator: Li Liu

media:content.media:description: Shipping containers at the Port of Los Angeles in Los Angeles.

item.title: Canada’s New Tariffs on US Drop to ‘Nearly Zero’ With Exemptions, Oxford Says
item.description: Canada has effectively suspended almost all of its retaliatory tariffs on US products, tamping down inflation risks and improving its growth outlook, according to Oxford Economics.
item.dc:creator: Derek Decloet

media:content.media:description: A truck crosses the Peace Bridge at the Canada-US border in Fort Erie, Ontario, Canada, on Wednesday, April 2, 2025. US President Trump on April 2 plans to roll out tariffs on global trading partners, the centerpiece of his effort to bring back manufacturing to the US and reshape a world trade system he has long decried as unfair.

item.title: Estonia Calls In Russian Diplomat After Airspace Violation
item.description: Estonia’s Foreign Ministry summoned the Russian embassy’s top official after a Russian military aircraft violated the Baltic country’s airspace.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Eglitis

media:content.media:description: A Russian Sukhoi Su-35 fighter jet.

item.title: Brazil Needs Fiscal Sense to Gain From Trade War, Speaker Says
item.description: Brazil has emerged as an early winner from Donald Trump’s trade war with China but needs to get its fiscal situation in order to attract investment and fully capitalize on the global upheaval, according to lower house Speaker Hugo Motta.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Carvalho, Vanessa Dezem

media:content.media:description: Hugo Motta Photographer: Raul Luciano/Agencia Estado/AP Images

item.title: Trump’s Mideast Visit Opens Floodgate of AI Deals Led by Nvidia
item.description: The Trump administration is clearing a path for two key Persian Gulf allies to pursue their artificial intelligence ambitions — and some of the biggest US tech companies are seizing on that opening with plans to spend billions of dollars in the region.
item.dc:creator: Michael Shepard, Mackenzie Hawkins, Ian King

media:content.media:description: President Donald Trump speaks during the Saudi-US business investment forum in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, on May 13, 2025.

item.title: Newsom Wants to End Free Health Care for Undocumented Adults
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom is proposing to end free health care for most undocumented immigrants, walking back one of his signature policies as the state faces a projected drop in tax revenue.
item.dc:creator: Eliyahu Kamisher, Maxwell Adler

media:content.media:description: Gavin Newsom

item.title: Switzerland Says It Has Power to Cap EU Immigration Unilaterally
item.description: Switzerland said it can cap immigration from the European Union unilaterally under its new agreement with the bloc, a move aimed at deflecting domestic criticism that the deal undermines its ability to manage its borders.
item.dc:creator: Bastian Benrath-Wright

media:content.media:description: A police officer checks a driver's passport on Austria’s border with Germany.

item.title: Bolivia President Arce Declines Candidacy, Calls for Left-Wing Unity
item.description: Bolivia’s President Luis Arce dropped his pursuit of reelection, calling for candidate Andronico Rodriguez to unite leftists ahead of the August vote and fend off a challenge from the right.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Mendoza

media:content.media:description: Luis Arce Photographer: Manuel Seoane/Bloomberg

item.title: Thiam Plans Surprise Return as Leader of Ivorian Opposition
item.description: Tidjane Thiam, former chief executive officer of Credit Suisse Group AG, is running unopposed to lead Ivory Coast’s main opposition party just days after he resigned from the post, a maneuver aimed at bypassing a challenge to his eligibility to fill the position.
item.dc:creator: Kamailoudini Tagba

media:content.media:description: Tidjane Thiam

item.title: Chinese Weapons Gain Credibility After Pakistan-India Conflict
item.description: The recent conflict between India and Pakistan is prompting a reassessment of Chinese weapons, challenging long-held perceptions of their inferiority to Western arms and sparking concern in places wary of Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Josh Xiao, Yian Lee, Sudhi Ranjan Sen

item.title: Here Are the Winners and Losers in the Republican Tax Bill
item.description: Wealthy Americans and business investors are among the big winners in House Republicans’ draft tax legislation while targets of President Donald Trump’s ire such as immigrants and elite universities were hammered.
item.dc:creator: Emily Birnbaum, Steven T. Dennis

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC.

item.title: Macron, Netanyahu Trade Barbs Over Israel’s Gaza Aid Block
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron accused Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of “shameful” behavior in blocking aid to Gaza, and called on the European Union to toughen its stance against the country.
item.dc:creator: Samy Adghirni

media:content.media:description: Emmanuel Macron, France's president, at the Elysee Palace in Paris, France, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. Friedrich Merz travels to Paris and Warsaw on Wednesday on his first foreign trip as German chancellor, still reeling from a humiliating setback in Tuesday’s government transition that raised early questions about his leadership.

item.title: Merz Commits Germany to Building Europe’s Strongest Military
item.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said his government’s top priority is to transform the nation’s military into Europe’s strongest conventional army to help counter the rising threat from Russia.
item.dc:creator: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber

media:content.media:description: Friedrich Merz speaks at the Bundestag in Berlin, on May 14. Photographer: Markus Schreiber/AP Photo

item.title: Petro Inks China Investment Deal in Test of Colombia-US Ties
item.description: President Gustavo Petro signed on to Beijing’s Belt and Road initiative in a bid to boost trade and Chinese investment in Colombia, though his top diplomat stressed the US remains the nation’s main ally.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Laya, Andrea Jaramillo

media:content.media:description: Xi Jinping shakes hands with Gustavo Petro at the Forum of China and Community of Latin American and Caribbean States in Beijing, on May 13.

item.title: How Milei Keeps Argentina’s Peso Strong Ahead of Midterm Vote
item.description: Five months ahead of crucial midterm elections in Argentina, the peso has become the cornerstone of Javier Milei’s campaign strategy.
item.dc:creator: Ignacio Olivera Doll

media:content.media:description: Argentina's currency has been trading below the midpoint of the 1,000 to 1,400 pesos per dollar band the government initially set on April 11. Photographer: Erica Canepa/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Pushes Supreme Court to Undercut the Judges Who Thwart Him
item.description: President Donald Trump is pressing the US Supreme Court to use a dispute over one of his most audacious immigration initiatives as a way to constrain the judges who keep thwarting his agenda.
item.dc:creator: Greg Stohr

media:content.media:description: The US Supreme Court in Washington.

item.title: Trump Tax Plan Gains Momentum in House as It Heads to Floor Vote
item.description: President Donald Trump’s signature economic package took a major step toward becoming law when the House Ways and Means Committee approved trillions in new tax cuts for corporations, households and small businesses on a party-line vote.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson, Chris Cioffi, Zach C Cohen

media:content.media:description: Jason Smith, center, during a markup of the tax package in Washington, DC, on May 13.
